leaf_cluster.leaf_cluster_name: 实验室自动化-机器人与设备集成生态
leaf_cluster.task_chain: 驱动→编排→记录→监控→审计
leaf_cluster.tool_form: 设备接口 + 调度 + 监控

unit.unit_name: 调度/队列/实验执行编排

tools.name: WEI
tools.one_line_profile: Workcell Execution Interface for autonomous discovery and self-driving laboratories
tools.detailed_description: A framework designed to manage and orchestrate workflows in autonomous discovery and self-driving laboratories (AD/SDLs), providing a standard interface for workcell execution.

tools.name: LabOP
tools.one_line_profile: Laboratory Open Protocol Language for standardizing lab workflows
tools.detailed_description: A Python implementation of the Laboratory Open Protocol (LabOP) language, designed to standardize the representation and execution of laboratory protocols across different automation platforms.

tools.name: LabOP Editor
tools.one_line_profile: Visual editor for Laboratory Open Protocol (LabOP)
tools.detailed_description: A web-based editor for creating and modifying Laboratory Open Protocol (LabOP) descriptions, facilitating the design of automated experiments.

tools.name: Orca
tools.one_line_profile: Scheduling and orchestration software for laboratory automation
tools.detailed_description: A scheduling software designed for laboratory automation, managing the execution of protocols and resource allocation in a lab setting.

tools.name: DistRL
tools.one_line_profile: Asynchronous distributed reinforcement learning framework for on-device control
tools.detailed_description: A framework for asynchronous distributed reinforcement learning, specifically designed for training control agents directly on devices, applicable in robotics and control systems research.

tools.name: OT-2 SiLA Controller
tools.one_line_profile: SiLA 2 compliant controller for Opentrons OT-2 liquid handlers
tools.detailed_description: A Python-based controller that exposes the Opentrons OT-2 liquid handling robot capabilities via the SiLA 2 (Standardization in Lab Automation) standard interface.

tools.name: Panda SiLA Controller
tools.one_line_profile: SiLA 2 compliant controller for Franka Emika Panda robot arms
tools.detailed_description: A C++ controller implementing the SiLA 2 standard for the Franka Emika Panda robot arm, enabling its integration into standardized lab automation workflows.

tools.name: SiLA Orchestrator
tools.one_line_profile: Dynamic SiLA 2 client for coordinating laboratory services
tools.detailed_description: A Java-based orchestrator that acts as a dynamic SiLA 2 client, allowing for the coordination and execution of workflows involving multiple SiLA 2 compliant laboratory devices.

tools.name: ADO
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for executing benchmarks and computational experiments at scale
tools.detailed_description: An extendible framework designed to facilitate the execution of large-scale benchmarks and computational experiments, suitable for evaluating scientific algorithms and systems.

tools.name: LabScript-AI
tools.one_line_profile: AI tool to generate Opentrons protocols from natural language
tools.detailed_description: An AI-powered tool that leverages natural language processing to automatically generate Python protocols for Opentrons liquid handling robots.

tools.name: Opentrons App & API
tools.one_line_profile: Control software and API for Opentrons liquid handling robots
tools.detailed_description: The official software stack for Opentrons robots (OT-2, Flex), including the Python API for protocol definition and the control application for executing experiments.

tools.name: PLACE
tools.one_line_profile: Python package for laboratory automation, control, and experimentation
tools.detailed_description: A Python package designed to facilitate laboratory automation, instrument control, and the orchestration of experimental workflows.

tools.name: PyLabRobot
tools.one_line_profile: Hardware agnostic SDK for laboratory automation and liquid handling
tools.detailed_description: PyLabRobot is a Python library that provides a hardware-agnostic interface for controlling laboratory robots, specifically liquid handlers (like Hamilton STAR, Opentrons). It enables researchers to write flexible, device-independent protocols for automated experiments.

tools.name: Aquarium.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable fluid-structure interaction solver for robotics
tools.detailed_description: Aquarium.jl is a Julia package providing a differentiable solver for fluid-structure interaction (FSI) problems, specifically designed for applications in soft robotics and control tasks where gradient-based optimization is required.

tools.name: LeeQ
tools.one_line_profile: Pulse sequence orchestration framework for quantum computing experiments
tools.detailed_description: LeeQ is a Python package designed to orchestrate and generate pulse sequences for quantum computing experiments. It provides a syntax for defining quantum control experiments and interfacing with hardware.

tools.name: SEML
tools.one_line_profile: Slurm Experiment Management Library for reproducible research
tools.detailed_description: SEML (Slurm Experiment Management Library) is a Python tool that simplifies running and managing large-scale machine learning and scientific experiments on Slurm clusters. It handles parameter configurations, job submission, and results tracking via MongoDB.

tools.name: EOS
tools.one_line_profile: Experiment Orchestration System framework for laboratory automation
tools.detailed_description: EOS (Experiment Orchestration System) is a software framework and runtime designed to orchestrate complex laboratory automation tasks. It manages the execution of experiments involving robotic hardware and software agents.

tools.name: Aquarium
tools.one_line_profile: Operating system for laboratory automation and workflow management
tools.detailed_description: Aquarium is a high-level operating system for laboratory automation that manages workflows, inventory, and protocols. It is designed to execute reproducible experiments in synthetic biology and other wet lab domains.

tools.name: Bluesky
tools.one_line_profile: Experiment orchestration and data acquisition system for synchrotrons and labs
tools.detailed_description: Bluesky is a library for experiment orchestration and data acquisition. It provides a high-level interface to control hardware, sequence experiments, and collect data, widely used in synchrotrons (like NSLS-II) and other scientific facilities.

tools.name: ClearML
tools.one_line_profile: MLOps platform for experiment tracking, orchestration, and model management
tools.detailed_description: ClearML is an open-source MLOps platform that automates the tracking, orchestration, and management of machine learning experiments. It is widely used in scientific research (AI4S) to manage reproducible AI model training and data processing pipelines.

tools.name: Dagger
tools.one_line_profile: Experiment orchestration platform for reproducible scientific research
tools.detailed_description: A Python-based experiment orchestration tool developed by Facebook Research, designed to manage, reproduce, and track complex computational experiments, particularly in AI and machine learning workflows.

tools.name: Gladier
tools.one_line_profile: SDK for developing Globus Flows to orchestrate distributed research data
tools.detailed_description: A Python SDK designed to facilitate the creation of Globus Flows, enabling the orchestration of data management and computation tasks across distributed research infrastructure, leveraging Globus Compute for scientific workflows.

tools.name: HeRoCars
tools.one_line_profile: Integrative simulator-hardware framework for robotics learning and research
tools.detailed_description: A robotics framework developed by the Heterogeneous Robotics Lab at UGA, combining a Unity-based simulator with low-cost hardware modules for robotized RC cars, enabling research in autonomous vehicle dynamics and control.

tools.name: LARA_AUBOi5_AG95
tools.one_line_profile: ROS integration packages for Aubo i5 robot and AG95 gripper
tools.detailed_description: A set of ROS packages developed for the LARA lab to integrate the Aubo i5 robotic arm with the DH Robotics AG95 gripper, supporting motion planning with MoveIt and simulation in Gazebo for laboratory automation tasks.

tools.name: Contrast
tools.one_line_profile: Data acquisition and orchestration framework for beamline experiments
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight Python framework developed by MAX IV Laboratory for orchestrating and controlling beamline experiments, managing hardware devices, and handling data acquisition workflows in synchrotron research.

tools.name: Skeletor
tools.one_line_profile: Lightweight orchestration tool for machine learning experiments
tools.detailed_description: A Python module designed to streamline the orchestration of machine learning experiments, handling configuration management, experiment tracking, and execution flows for computational research.

tools.name: LRAUV Simulation
tools.one_line_profile: Simulation packages for Long-Range Autonomous Underwater Vehicles
tools.detailed_description: A set of simulation packages for the Tethys-class Long-Range AUV (LRAUV), developed by OSRF and MBARI, enabling researchers to simulate underwater vehicle dynamics, control systems, and environmental interactions for oceanographic research.

tools.name: Firewheel
tools.one_line_profile: Orchestration tool for distributed network system experiments
tools.detailed_description: An experiment orchestration framework developed by Sandia National Laboratories for building, controlling, and scaling repeatable experiments on distributed network systems, supporting complex topology generation and traffic simulation.

tools.name: GLAS
tools.one_line_profile: Git-based scheduling architecture for integral lab automation
tools.detailed_description: GLAS (Git-based Lab Automation Scheduler) is an open-source, expandable architecture designed for integral lab automation. It utilizes Git for version control and scheduling of experimental workflows, enabling distributed control and orchestration of laboratory devices within a scientific research context.

tools.name: COPICK
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for adapting Opentrons 2 robots for colony picking protocols
tools.detailed_description: COPICK is a framework designed to adapt the Opentrons 2 liquid handling robot for automated colony picking tasks. It provides the necessary logic and control interfaces to perform colony selection and transfer, specifically tailored for systems biology and microbiology workflows.
